fields.description:
*Descrption of problem:*

During startup a Johnson warning may occur. This causes the user to be directed to errors.jsp.

In some cases errors.jsp will show text advising of a startup flag that can be used to ignore the warnings. The flag shown in the text does not work as expected.

The text that appears in the UI is currently as follows.

{code}
johnson.warnings.ignore.cli = If you want to ignore these warnings and start JIRA, you need to \{0}--ignore-warnings-on-startup\{1} using a startup flag that will ignore the warnings.
{code}

This is not a working startup flag. The working flag is -Djira.startup.warnings.disable=true
fields.summary: johnson.warnings.ignore.cli shows incorrect flag

fields.description:
*Description* *of problem:*

The startup argument "-Djira.startup.warnings.disable=true" is not present in the documentation related to startup options.
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]

This argument can be used to bypass startup warnings (johnson warnings) apppearing on errors.jsp page
 * This page and warnings may appear after an upgrade.

*Notes*

The text that appears in the UI is currently as follows.
{code:java}
johnson.warnings.ignore.cli = If you want to ignore these warnings and start JIRA, you need to {0}--ignore-warnings-on-startup{1} using a startup flag that will ignore the warnings.
{code}
This is not a working startup flag. The correct flag is -Djira.startup.warnings.disable=true

This is addressed in JRASERVER-67810
fields.summary: jira.startup.warnings.disable startup option missing from documentation

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Jira.
# Create a custom field of type "Date Time Picker"
# Go to Issues -> Search for issues. (Basic view)
# Select the custom field you've just created
# Select any date using Between and update.
# Then, try to input the values of the date range manually.
# Receive message - Please shorten this text to 12 characters or less (You are currently using 16 characters.)
## By making it short, you'll receive the message - Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy".
# You won't be able to type any value in the field manually. (It only works selecting from the calendar.)

h3. Expected Results
Be able to type the values in the field (Between) manually.

h3. Actual Results
Any manual input results in error messages

h3. Workaround
Use the date picker to select the date and time.
fields.summary: Basic search criteria for "Date Time Picker" doesn't allow manual input.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As part of JRASERVER-65913 new _docValuesCache_ was added to optimize memory usage.

It appeared that the change introduced series of bugs which rendered the cache unusable:
 * use of custom finalizer causes unnecessary cache clearing,
 * incorrect registering of {{reader finished listener}} also adds up to the extensive cache clearing,
 * having a composite key in the cache requires iterating over it's elements in order to clear proper entries

Under high load cleaning up that cache concurrently from multiple threads might lead to increased CPU usage due to contention.
h3. Environment
 * Jira with large number issues + CustomFields
 * High number of actions which creates _JiraDocValues_:
 ** report generations
 ** issue create/edit

h3. Expected Results

Moderate CPU usage
h3. Actual Results
 * Higher CPU CPU.
 * Thread dump show contentions around this part, those threads are all CPU active:
{noformat}
 98.61%   [71/72] X at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:198)
 29.17%   [21/72] \ at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.requestcleanup.RequestCleanupStep.finallyAfterDoFilter(RequestCleanupStep.java:45)
 29.17%   [21/72]  \ at com.atlassian.jira.util.searchers.ThreadLocalSearcherCache.resetSearchers(ThreadLocalSearcherCache.java:31)
 29.17%   [21/72]   \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.flushThreadLocalSearchers(DefaultIndexManager.java:1020)
 29.17%   [21/72]    \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearchers(SearcherCache.java:60)
 29.17%   [21/72]     \ at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearcher(SearcherCache.java:79)
 29.17%   [21/72]      \ at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher.close(DelayCloseSearcher.java:57)
 29.17%   [21/72]       \ at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper.close(DelayCloseable.java:76)
 29.17%   [21/72]        \ at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper$UsageTracker.decrement(DelayCloseable.java:116)
 29.17%   [21/72]         \ at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper$UsageTracker.executeUnderLockClosingWhenDone(DelayCloseable.java:143)
 29.17%   [21/72]          \ at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher$SearcherCloser.close(DelayCloseSearcher.java:74)
 29.17%   [21/72]           X at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher$SearcherCloser.decReaderRef(DelayCloseSearcher.java:88)
{noformat}

 * Example of the thread stack trace:
{noformat}
"http-nio2-8080-exec-715" #335632 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fd2dc731000 nid=0x1457a runnable [0x00007fd1abd13000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$HashIterator.advance(LocalCache.java:4274)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$HashIterator.nextEntry(LocalCache.java:4349)
        at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$KeyIterator.next(LocalCache.java:4365)
        at java.util.Iterator.forEachRemaining(Iterator.java:116)
        at java.util.Spliterators$IteratorSpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:1801)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
        at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:151)
        at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:174)
        at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
        at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:418)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.DefaultReaderCache.invalidateCacheForCoreCacheKey(DefaultReaderCache.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.DefaultReaderCache.access$200(DefaultReaderCache.java:16)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.DefaultReaderCache$InvalidateReaderFinishedListener.finished(DefaultReaderCache.java:151)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.notifyReaderFinishedListeners(IndexReader.java:127)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.readerFinished(IndexReader.java:133)
        at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.decRef(IndexReader.java:250)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher$SearcherCloser.decReaderRef(DelayCloseSearcher.java:88)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher$SearcherCloser.close(DelayCloseSearcher.java:74)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper$UsageTracker.executeUnderLockClosingWhenDone(DelayCloseable.java:143)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper$UsageTracker.decrement(DelayCloseable.java:116)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper.close(DelayCloseable.java:76)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher.close(DelayCloseSearcher.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearcher(SearcherCache.java:79)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearchers(SearcherCache.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.flushThreadLocalSearchers(DefaultIndexManager.java:1020)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.searchers.ThreadLocalSearcherCache.resetSearchers(ThreadLocalSearcherCache.java:31)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.requestcleanup.RequestCleanupStep.finallyAfterDoFilter(RequestCleanupStep.java:45)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.ChainedFilterStepRunner.doFilter(ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:78)
..
{noformat}

h3. Notes
 * While cleaning the cache, thread iterates over all cache entries.
 * Cache eviction policy is expire after access - that means that it needs to track every read to it's entries in order to keep records for further eviction.
 * It does that by counting a number of reads with CAS operation (thread safe, but very hot in case of contention) in readCount.incrementAndGet()

The contention is caused by two factors
 * Iterating over cache entries way to often from multiple threads,
 * CAS overhead during Guave cache maintenance (counting number of reads with {{AtomicInteger}})

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Increased CPU usage due to contention in docValuesCache

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an Administrator deleted a project, the progress bar after the operation indicates that the process is incomplete.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Create a test project.
# Access the project detail page.
# Delete the project.
# Check the progress bar above "Task completed in 0 seconds" sentence.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.10.1, 7.11.0


h3. Expected Results

Progress bar reaches 100% after the project is deleted.


h3. Actual Results

Progress bar never reaches 100% after the project is deleted.


h3.Workaround

None. This is the UI bug and the project will be deleted from JIRA.
fields.summary: Incomplete progress bar after deleting project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Lucene uses {{org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentNorms}} for Fulltext search. 
Initially, those data structures are created as files on disk: 
{noformat}
ls -al caches/indexes/issues/*.nrm
181030 caches/indexes/issues/_b4w.nrm
{noformat}
and then later Lucene loads them into memory and stores in {{SegmentNorms}}.

That means the bigger the Lucene Norm size the more memory will be required for them in JVM heap

* For large Jira instances (4+ mln issues) {{SegmentNorms}} might use up to 6GB+, which adds extra pressure for the JVM
* They're recalculated on each write to the index, due to JRASERVER-67125, so it's highly advisable to update to the corresponding version. 

h4. Heap dump details
Example of histogram: 
||Class Name                                                        ||    Objects ||  Shallow Heap ||     Retained Heap||
|org.apache.lucene.index.ReadOnlySegmentReader    |        167 |        14.696 |  >= 3.998.311.056|
|org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentNorms                     |    308.254 |    17.262.224 |  >= 3.828.471.112|

Dominator tree:
 !Dom_tree.png|thumbnail! 

searcher: {{org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher}}
reader: {{org.apache.lucene.index.ReadOnlyDirectoryReader}} which loads {{org.apache.lucene.index.ReadOnlySegmentReader}}
which uses  {{org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentNorms}} 

h3. Suggested Solution
Optimize memory usage of the {{SegmentNorms}}.
According to Lucene docs, those structures are gone in latest versions, so upgrade of Lucene should fix the problem. 

h3. Workaround 
Since memory usage  is proportional to number of Lucene docuements and size of the Norms, there are a couple of workarounds here, in the order of preference:
# Disable Lucene search index for unused CustomFields 
# Reduce scope for CustomFields (limit for specific projects)
# Keep Norms smalls by running full reindex periodically
fields.summary: Improve SegmentNorms  memory utilisation for Jira instances with large Lucene

fields.description:
The sizing guide documentation was recently replaced with https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-size-profiles-955171062.html

However, there are no recommendations  based on the size profiles categorized. 

Can we have a page providing the recommendation based on the size profiles similar to the old sizing guide page ? 

In addition to that, the new documentation is also for JIRA Data Center. Although it can also be applied to JIRA Standalone, this will cause confusion among customers who are not using JIRA Data Center.
fields.summary: Sizing Guide Documentation

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I would like to be able to set a default sharing group in my Profile Preferences for all of my new filters and boards to a specific Jira group (possibly reflecting my department or team), so I don't have to modify the share settings for every filter and board I create.

As it is today (JIRA Server 7.3.8), I can only select sharing ON or OFF, not a particular group.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA users to share filters and boards to a JIRA group by default

fields.description:
h2. Background
Currently, the Supported Platforms documentation from JIRA 7.1 through to JIRA 7.5 states that Oracle 12C is supported. However, from the [Supported Platforms of JIRA 7.6|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/supported-platforms-945110772.html] onwards, it is explicitly stated that only Oracle 12C R1 is supported.

For clarification, Oracle 12C R2 is not yet supported and there is a feature request open here at [JRASERVER-67079|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67079].

h2. Suggestion
Update the documentation of Supported Platforms below to explicitly indicate that only Oracle 12C R1 is supported.

[JIRA 7.1 Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/supported-platforms-802592168.html]
[JIRA 7.2 Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/supported-platforms-828787550.html]
[JIRA 7.3 Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/supported-platforms-861253018.html]
[JIRA 7.4 Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/supported-platforms-881683157.html]
[JIRA 7.5 Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/supported-platforms-935390828.html]
fields.summary: Update JIRA 7.1 - 7.5 Supported Platform to indicate that Oracle 12C R2 is not supported.

fields.description:
h2. +Summary+

*Problem 1:* Hercules Scan is CPU intensive (taking > 90% CPU resources) and it was triggered automatically when visiting page: _"Troubleshooting and support tools"._

*Problem 2:* Hercules thread cannot stopped in certain condition, when you click on _"Troubleshooting and support tools" page,_ Log analyzer/Hercules is automatically triggered, at this point if you click "Cancel" on UI the hercules thread status will change from Running to Timed_Waiting which is expected. {color:#de350b}+*Here comes the problem*+{color}, visit the page _"Troubleshooting and support tools" > Log analyzer started > Before it completes, visit the page again_ _"Troubleshooting and support tools" > Noticed the status stucks at 0% > Cancel the operation on UI > Thread is still shown as Running,_

_!image-2018-08-16-22-06-15-566.png|width=650,height=229!_

_!image-2018-08-16-22-06-56-269.png!_
h2. +Expected Results+

*Problem 1:* Hercules scan should not be taking so much CPU and it shouldn't start scanning automatically when visiting page: _"Troubleshooting and support tools"._

*Problem 2:* Hercules scan should not be executed again when visiting the page 2nd time, or better yet do not allow auto-trigger when visiting the page. And also, the thread should be allowed to cancel even though the page is visited multiple times.**

 
h2. +Actual Results+

*Problem 1:* Hercules scan is taking too much CPU > 90% and it auto-triggered when visiting the page.

*Problem 2:* Hercules thread cannot be stopped when visiting the page multiple times.
fields.summary: Hercules Scan is CPU intensive & Hercules Thread cannot stop

fields.description:
h5. Problem definition
On an issue view, clicking on {{More > Linking}} allows users to link the issue with another Jira issue, Confluence page (if integrated) or any web page URL as per [this doco|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/linking-issues-939937913.html#Linkingissues-CreatingalinktoanywebpageURL].

However, it's not possible to link an issue using non-HTTP protocols like _doors://_, _notes://_ and etc.

h5. Suggested solution
Allow issue linking using non-HTTP protocols
fields.summary: It's not possible to link an issue with non-HTTP protocols like doors://, notes://, ftp:// and etc

fields.description:
Currently, mail loop detection configuration is placed on Incoming Mail page (go to Jira settings > System > Incoming Mail), within Advanced Configuration section. 

From the linked [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-solve-jira-service-desk-mail-loops-720411603.html], it is visible this setting is also valid for Service Desk. However, that is not very clear from the configuration section, since it's placed on Incoming mail page.

It would be more adequate if:
* Mail loop configuration would have it's own dedicated page for Service Desk or if
* Service Desk Email requests settings would be place within Incoming Mail page.
fields.summary: Place mail loop detection configuration for Jira Service Desk somewhere else

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When multiple validators are configured for a transition, Jira does not display user-level exception from the custom validator, showing generic system-level exception instead:

{noformat}admin.errors.exception com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: Error occurred while creating issue through workflow:{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# install JSU plugin.
# Edit project's workflow, "Create" transition
# Add a new validator, e.g. "Required field", add "Comment" to the required field, f.e.
# Set the custom exception message that supposed to be displayed to users
# Save, publish
# Try to clone any issue

h3. Expected Results

Custom error message should be shown to the user, allowing him to correct the mistake

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

{noformat}2018-08-16 12:33:58,705 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 ERROR dmadmin 753x1268x1 xwgb7e 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CloneIssueDetails.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Error occurred while creating issue through workflow:
com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: Error occurred while creating issue through workflow:
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:516)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssueObject(DefaultIssueManager.java:608)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.RequestCachingIssueManager.createIssueObject(RequestCachingIssueManager.java:209)

	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.CloneIssueCommand.call(CloneIssueCommand.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:458)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:426)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: [InvalidInputException: [Error map: [{comment=comment?}]] [Error list: [[]]]
	at ch.beecom.jira.jsu.util.ValidatorErrorsBuilder.process(ValidatorErrorsBuilder.java:47)
	at ch.beecom.jira.jsu.workflow.check.AbstractCheck.validate(AbstractCheck.java:97)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira logs all events 2x times to Log4j file and STDOUT (catalina.out).
That uses 2x space and creates extra load for the disk (see JRASERVER-28941).

h3. Suggested Solution
Don't log Jira events to STDOUT
* Keep those loggers for the supportability: 
** log4j.logger.com.atlassian.upgrade
** log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.upgrade
** log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.startup
** log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.config.database
* Increase the number of _atlassian-jira.log_ files from 5 to 10 to compensate the change
 
h3. Workaround 
* Remove all {{console}} from log specific logging events, see examples
{code:borderStyle=solid}
-log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN, console, filelog
+log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN,  filelog
 log4j.additivity.com.atlassian = false
{code}
sed code:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
sed '230,$s/console,//' ./log4j.properties > ./log4j.properties_new
{code}
fields.summary: Don't log Jira events to STDOUT - catalina.out

fields.description:
Currently, only way of configuring slideshow of dashboards is through wallboard, which is not feature-rich and does not display all content. 

It would be good if users would be able to switch automatically between (walk through) their configured dashboards (basically, to set up a slideshow consisting of all user's dashboards).
fields.summary: Add possibility to slide through multiple dashboards (not wallboard slideshow)

fields.summary: Create a User Management Permission Group
When a user is marked as inactive, the current user session is not killed

fields.description:
As a Jira Admin, I need a quick way to list all projects that are using the default priority scheme.

In the "Projects" column of the "Default priority scheme" we can only see: _Global (all unconfigured projects)_.

 !Priority Scheme.png|thumbnail! 

This makes it difficult to determine what projects are using it.
h3. Workaround

Use the following SQL query against the Jira database to list all projects that are +not+ using a custom priority scheme, which indicates the default priority scheme is being used.
{code:sql}
SELECT pname AS "Project"
FROM project
WHERE id NOT IN (SELECT project FROM configurationcontext WHERE customfield = 'priority' AND project IS NOT NULL)
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to list all projects that are using the default priority scheme

fields.description:
On the left side of a board is the following menu of modules:

!image-2018-08-15-13-21-08-831.png!

I was wondering if it's possible to change what they're called without actually changing what they do. For example, we won't be doing software releases, but want to use the Versions module without changing its functionality. Can we change its name?
fields.summary: Changing what modules are called

fields.description:
When trying to associate a scheme to project, when you click the "associate" link, it presents you a list of all projects and highlights the projects that are already associated with the selected scheme. If the user just left click a project it will unselect all projects that were previously highlighted and, applying the changes, will disassociate all other projects from that scheme.

This can create some confusion and lead a Jira Admin to mistakenly dissociate multiple projects from a scheme.

This behaviour can be seen in the Issue Type Scheme and Priority Scheme screens.
fields.summary: Improve the associate scheme behaviour

fields.description:
Currently, when an email is received by an incoming mail handler, new issues are created in a single default project.  While there are methods to support multiple projects for new issues, the configuration required for each project creates significant overhead and greatly reduces the utility of this feature for organizations that have a large number of projects.

 

It would be ideal if the incoming mail handler could *route the new issue to a project based on a project key in the subject line*, much as the incoming mail handler can currently route a comment to an issue if the issue key is present in the subject.

E.g. 
{code:java}
 Subject: (ABC) This is a feature request{code}
Would create a new issue in project *ABC*.

Subjects containing neither a project key or issue key would create an issue in the default project.
fields.summary: Incoming mail handler: Use project key in subject to select project for new issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, none of the columns in UserBrowser.jspa are sortable which can make it difficult to filter for inactive users and a users last login date.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Columns should be sortable by clicking on column headers
 * Break out Active/Inactive status as a separate column
 * Break out Last login date as separate columns

h3. Why this is important

Sorting users by Active/Inactive status and last login date helps us determine potential licenses we can reuse from inactive users.
h3. Workaround
 * Show the entire table, copy and paste into Excel and manually massage the columns, rows, formats to get the view needed.
 * Retrieve inactive users/last login dates via SQL query as described in: [Retrieve last login dates for users via the database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/retrieve-last-login-dates-for-users-from-the-database-363364638.html] and [Search for inactive users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/search-for-inactive-users-346947771.html]
fields.summary: Make columns in UserBrowser.jspa sortable

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
JIRA's _look and feel_ top navigation bar menu item highlight text colour does not contrast correctly when a user hovers over menu items. By default it is white, but when the user points on a menu item, it's text color will remain the same. 
Following, if in Jira's "Look and feel" menu we click on the *Revert* button for _Menu Item Highlight Text Color_, it will revert to a white menu item even if we refresh the browser or clear browser cache. This issue does not happen if we update the color manually using color code / color selection tools. 
(i) *Note:* Refresh the browser after changes are made in "Look and feel" to allow the browser to load the updated color configuration.

h3. *Environment*
JIRA Version: 7.11

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Install a new JIRA 7.11 instance and you will be able to reproduce the issue by hover over menu issue list
# You can try to change "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" manually and refresh browser. It will update accordingly
# Once you updated manually and it works, try click "*Revert*" for "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" in look and feel
(i) Must use revert button, update manually to white color will not able reproduce the behavior
# Refresh browser and re-try hover over menu item

h3.*Expected Results*
JIRA look and feel will show its default value accordingly.

h3.*Actual Results*
After upgrade, and we restored XML backup with the look and feel configurations, it won't work. We need to manually update "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" again to trigger it to function.

h3.*Workaround*
# Try to update "*Menu Item Highlight Text Colour*" color to "#ff00ff"
# Refresh browser to check if highlighted text color updated accordingly
# Try to update "*Menu Item Highlight Text Colour*" color to "#ffffff" manually. Don't use *revert* button
# Refresh your browser and check if the highlighted text was shown as white color
(i) If the issue persists, kindly try clear browser cache/open incognito mode browser to re-check. Sometimes it may due to browser cache storing old configuration.

fields.description:
When we perform workflow transition, the update history time tooltips only showing hours instead of actual time include minutes. 

h3. *Summary*
In JIRA 7.11, after we updated a workflow transition, its history's tooltips time will only show hours instead of full time include minutes. In JIRA 7.6.6, it will show full time formatting such as "Today 8.02PM". This issue only impacting workflow transition history. If we trigger a comment added history, it will show full timing accordingly. 

Since it is showing hours, if the changes were made 2 hours 49 minutes ago, it will show 3 hours and when we point our mouse on the time, it will show 2 hours instead. This caused a lot of confusion.

h3. *Environment*
JIRA Version: 7.11

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Trigger a workflow transition
# Wait for 2 hours/change your time to 2 hours later
# Open the issue history and hover your mouse on the time

h3.*Expected Results*
(i) *Below image was captured in JIRA 7.6.6*
!image-2018-08-15-23-15-41-495.png|thumbnail!  
!image-2018-08-15-23-16-32-739.png|thumbnail! 

h3.*Actual Results*
(i) *Below image was captured in JIRA 7.11*
!image-2018-08-15-23-13-01-835.png|thumbnail!  
!image-2018-08-15-23-14-07-512.png|thumbnail! 

h3.*Workaround*
Currently, there is no workaround available.
fields.summary: Time Tooltips Show Hours Instead of Actual Time in Workflow Update History JIRA 7.11

fields.description:
Each time transitioning issue this  error appears in the logs creating a lot of noise.

{code}
2018-06-11 15:25:24,088 http-nio-8080-exec-30 WARN k80648 925x1590771x1 1jilfl9 159.216.5.34,159.216.228.115 /secure/CommentAssignIssue!default.jspa [c.a.j.w.action.issue.CommentAssignIssue] The i18n key in property 'jira.i18n.description' for this transition does not contain a valid i18n key.
{code}

h3. Cause
no value is set in the workflow  for jira.i18n.description 
{code}
<action id="101" name="Cancel" view="fieldscreen">
<meta name="jira.i18n.submit">sd.workflow.save</meta>
<meta name="jira.description"/>
<meta name="jira.i18n.description"/>
<meta name="jira.fieldscreen.id">13554</meta>
{code}

Causing the warning to appear.

h3. workaround 
The error can be ignored since it doesn't break any functionality.

To disable logging :
- ⚙ > System > Profile and logging > click on : "Configure logging level for another package."
- add the package : com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.CommentAssignIssue > set the logging level to ERROR
fields.summary: Transitioning issue causes noise in the logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Administrators may wish to debug Jira's Issue Collectors; for example, when administrators want to track the Issue Collector's failure reasons (see [JRASERVER-67775 : Unknown error when submitting Issue Collector with empty required field is confusing|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67775]). It's possible to enable DEBUG logging against the {{com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest}} package in order to better monitor the Issue Collectors; however, doing so seems to cause NullPointerExceptions in the logs, while preventing useful warnings from being presented to users, when they fail to create issues via the Issue Collectors for any reason. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a new Issue Collector with a mandatory field (i.e. "Summary")
# Enable DEBUG logging against {{com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest}}
# Attempt to submit an issue to the collector while leaving the mandatory field empty

h3. Expected Results
Behaviors resemble that when DEBUG logging is not enabled:
* UI will present an error to the user indicating the failure reason ("You must specify a summary of the issue.")
**  !Missing_Summary.png|thumbnail! 
* Application Logs will include the DEBUG level logging, explaining the failure reason to the administrators

h3. Actual Results
* UI no longer presents a useful error to the user with a failure reason
**  !oops.png|thumbnail! 
* Application Logs throw NullPointerExceptions
** {code}2018-08-14 22:32:49,701 http-nio-8080-exec-2 ERROR kliou 1352x1030x1 t9baem 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/collectors/1.0/template/custom/902e0a31 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:210)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest.TemplateResource.createIssue(TemplateResource.java:453)
	at com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest.TemplateResource.createCustomIssue(TemplateResource.java:398)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor824.invoke(Unknown Source)
	... 1 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	...
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748){code}

h3. Notes
These circumstances only happen when the issue fails to create; if mandatory fields are filled in, issue creation proceeds as normal. No error is thrown in the UI, and no NPE is thrown in the logs.

An administrator would likely run into this issue when trying to work around [JRASERVER-67775 : Unknown error when submitting Issue Collector with empty required field is confusing|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67775]

h3. Workaround
None- refrain from using DEBUG logging against this package if possible
fields.summary: NullPointerException in Issue Collector when DEBUG logging is enabled on com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest package

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira, when submitting an issue via an Issue Collector, if a mandatory field such as Summary is not filled in, the Issue Collector will warn the user and force them to fill in the field before allowing them to submit the issue.

 !Missing_Summary.png|thumbnail! 

However, as an Administrator, when reviewing the *Issue Collectors* for the Jira project in question, each of these failures is logged as an "Unknown Error".

 !Unknown_Error.png|thumbnail! 

This is confusing for the admin who has no reliable way of knowing for sure what the user in question had failed to do while submitting the issue, and at worst may cause the admin to believe that there is something wrong with the issue collector.

h3. Suggested Solution

When a user fails to create an issue via an Issue Collector due to a failure to fill out a mandatory field, the error in the Project Administration should be much more clear in explaining what the failure reason was. In the above example, there should be an explicit mention of a mandatory field being missing, and which field in question.

h3. Why this is important
 
Administrators currently have no way of knowing what the failure reason is for these Issue Collectors. Even worse, is they lose the ability to determine whether there is an *actual* problem with the Issue Collector.

h3. Workaround 

None; trying to enable DEBUG logging on Issue Collectors to monitor more closely can result in [JRASERVER-67776 : NullPointerException in Issue Collector when DEBUG logging is enabled on com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.rest package|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67776]
fields.summary: Unknown error when submitting Issue Collector with empty required field is confusing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the WYSIWYG editor in visual mode and using the button to add an external link, the link will disappear if you simply replace the example URL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue.
# In the issue description, click the *Link* button and click on *External link*. The following text will be inserted in the description:
{noformat}
[link title|http://example.com]
{noformat}
# Replace {{http://example.com}} with an external URL.

h3. Expected Results
The URL is replaced and displayed in the editor.

h3. Actual Results
The whole URL wiki markup code disappears as soon as you paste the external URL.
 
h3. Notes
This happens with the WYSIWYG visual editor both in comments and the issue description.

h3.Workaround
Use text mode to add the external link.
fields.summary: Pasting a URL in the external link added by the WYSIWYG makes the URL disappear

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open text field in "text" mode.
 # Add wiki markdown to a comment that references an already uploaded attachment. ([alias|^file.extension])
 # Also add some regular text. EX. "Hello World"
 # Save.
 # Edit Comment.
 # Switch to visual mode.
 # Edit your added regular text.
 # Save.
 # Observe file type/extension is how the link is referenced. 

*Video below for reference to reproduce.*

*Expected Result:* Attachments link renders as attachment name given in markdown.

*Actual Result:* Attachment link renders as file type/extension.
fields.summary: Editing in Visual Mode causes attachment links to remove alias for the link

Hi,

I am a huge user of scrum boards and we have about 25 teams in our organization on them. One of the main activities that our product owners do is manage our epics. In the epic board, it is not easy to both see the detailed view of an epic and the list to be able to reorder/prioritze them. To accomplish this we create a second board (kanban) with just epics and one column so that we can order our epics and see the description/priority/etc easily.

However, in your new-ish Detailed View in Issues (search for issues), If you would allow me reorder(rerank - drag up and down) my issues in Detailed View when I'm Ordered/Sorted by Rank, then this would be completely solved, provide us a much better and more integrated view of epics  and just simply be really wonderful.

Thanks for your consideration.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, the feature of Incremental Sync is only available for Active Directory only where JIRA would refer to the AD USNChanged attribute to check if the record has been updated. It appears OpenLDAP has a slapd module that will provide a 'usn' overlay to maintain the 'usnCreated' and 'usnChanged' operational attributes normally used by Microsoft ActiveDirectory.
- https://github.com/delphij/openldap/tree/master/contrib/slapd-modules/usn

h3. Suggestion Solution:
It will be great for JIRA to implement Incremental Sync as well for OpenLDAP which it should also help the performance as it does not need to fully sync the entire directory every interval.
fields.summary: Incremental Sync for OpenLDAP

fields.description:
On version 7.11.1 of JIRA, the shortcut to save editions is alt+`.

The "backtick" is actually a grave accent: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%60
It is normally a dead key because its main functionality is to adorn vowels to change their phonetics: aàáäã, è, ò, ì, ù.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dead_key

In keyboards for romance languages (PT, FR, etc) the backtick is a dead key.
Because of that, *it is not possible to trigger the shortcut alt+` in these keyboards.*
The way to write a lone grave accent is to press ` and then space, or to press ` twice and then deleting the second accent.

The same applies to all these symbols/dead keys: ~ ^ ` ´ ¨
fields.summary: Do not use dead keys for shortcuts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Presently, _optional_ permission types (*reportercreate*, *assigneeassignable*) are set in permission-types.xml along with the _mandatory_ permission types. This can lead to issues during major upgrades as the customised files need to be manually migrated over.

As a practical example, the *applicationRole* permission type was added in Jira 7, and thus copying over a customised permission-types.xml from a Jira 6 installation would miss the new type and lead to undesired behavior.
h3. Suggested Solution

Split the _optional_ permission types to a separate file to ease the upgrade process.
h3. Workaround

Manually merge customisations from permission-types.xml when upgrading.
fields.summary: Split optional permissions from permission-types.xml into separate file

fields.description:

fields.summary: Filter use in dashboard should have basic accounting of if the filter is in use

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Would like to prevent Jira from having too many permission schemes associated with the same project. 

h4. Steps to Reproduce

Modifying database or using third-party plugin modifying permission scheme for a project sometimes can cause multiple permission schemes are associated with the same project. 

h4. Actual Results

Jira will return the following message in atlassian-jira.log

{noformat}
2015-04-09 20:50:23,001 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR [atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] Unable to start JIRA.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Too many PermissionScheme schemes found for Project TEST 
at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractSchemeManager.getSchemeIdFor(AbstractSchemeManager.java:275)
at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.getSchemeIdFor(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:628)
at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.hasSchemePermission(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:543)
at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.doProjectPermissionCheck(DefaultPermissionManager.java:350)
at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermission(DefaultPermissionManager.java:208)
{noformat}

In GUI, Jira will display 500 error "Sorry, we had some technical problems during your last operation. Cause: Too many PermissionScheme Schemes found for project xxx"

h4. Expected Results

* Ideally this should never occur, Jira should prevent the second permission scheme to be added when the project already has a permission scheme. 
* Jira should display a more clear message indicate the next action to fix the issue. 

h4. Workaround

Remove the duplicate permission scheme entry in database, restart Jira. 
Refer to more details in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/too-many-permissionscheme-schemes-found-for-project-728629717.html].
fields.summary: Prevent multiple permission schemes to be associated with the same project

fields.description: When filters are deleted, there is no audit record recorded. If a filter was shared and subsequently gets deleted, users lose access to it, it breaks their dashboard gadget for others' that had it favorited, and there's no audit log to trace back for analysis.
fields.summary: Deleting filters should record audit log entry

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Click on ' Add tab ' button multiple times on issue screen configuration will cause multiple requests to be sent when ' Add ' button is pressed later on
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create and configure a new issue screen.
 # Press the "Add tab + " button.
 # Enter a tab name. (in my case, I used "1")
 # Repeat Step 2 and 3. (in my case, I repeated the steps for over 100 times)
 # Lastly, press the "Add" button only once. This will send all the requests (although in UI, it appears as only one "add tab") over to JIRA.

h3. *Expected Results*

JIRA should only add one tab and ignore the rest.
h3. *Actual Results*

There are two possible outcomes: 
# Internal error causing users unable to further configure the screen: 
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 11.44.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Duplicate tab with the same name added to JIRA UI and database: 
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 11.24.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 11.24.39 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Notes*

+Possible Outcome 1:+
In some cases, the internal error will resolve itself after some time. 

+Possible Outcome 2:+
Please note that the duplicated tab can still be removed/deleted. 

h3. *Workaround*

There is no workaround other than not to spam the "Add tab +" button.
fields.summary: Click on ' Add tab ' button multiple times on issue screen configuration will cause multiple requests to be sent when ' Add ' button is pressed later on

fields.description:

Environment

Steps to Reproduce

 ** Solution Design - Proposed Design
 ** Solution Design - My Testing Two
 ** Solution Design - My Third testing
 ** Solution Design - My Last Testing

2 Dimensional Filter to recognize filter for all type of filter mame.

Actual Results
The 2 dimensional filter gadget couldn't recognize it.

Use advance filter instead or the dropdown box. It allow us to perform advance search and find required filter.

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
While using edge browser the Assignee system field is not updating the assignee.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the Edit screen of an issue type in a project to have 2 screen tabs
# Add Assignee field to the second tab
# Create a new issue of that issue type in that project
# Assign the issue to current user (by clicking Assign to me)
# Click Edit and check the second tab

h3. Expected behavior
The Assignee field contains current user as Assignee.

h3. Actual behavior
The Assignee field is empty. Upon clicking Update the value of Assignee field is set to Unassigned (default Assignee of project/component).

h3. Workaround
Only manual workarounds are available:
# Manually set the Assignee field value back to current user on the screen
# If #1 is missed and the field value changes, manually click Assign to me to set it back
# Use Chrome or Firefox if possible
fields.summary: Assignee System Field not working in Microsoft Edge

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, multi-select system fields appear to have more option on how it can be Bulk-edited. Example below: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
But, there is no information regarding this to be found in the documentation itself:
- [Editing Multiple Issues at the same time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-939937916.html]
(!) The dropdown is not expanding correctly as well.

This information appears to be added in JIRA 6.4 Release Notes where the feature is introduced but not yet included in the documentation itself:
- [JIRA 6.4 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/jira-6-4-release-notes-720414168.html]

{quote}
Another notable improvement has been how JIRA handles bulk editing of multi-select fields, like Version and Components. Now, you're able to select whether you want to *clear* or *add* to all the existing values, *replace all* the existing values with a specific value or set of values, or simply *remove a specific* value or set of values. 
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Include this information in the documentation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking on the Cog sign for the Activity Stream on the Project Summary page, gives us a pop-up. However, this is blocked on the Project Description.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Project Summary page. Make sure you have some activities done on the project, such as create a new issue.
# Click on the Cog sign on the Activity Stream.

h3. Expected Results
The pop-up sign to reload should be visible

h3. Actual Results
The pop up is visible, but the area of the pop up is blocked:
!popup.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The Cog icon only shows an option to reload the page when clicked on. To workaround this issue, you can refresh the whole page instead of just that gadget. Reloading the page will also reload the content in the Activity gadget.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
From Project settings -> Users and roles, the Roles drop-down list has a maximum width by default.

In case there're multiple roles with long names, all starting with the same prefix, the list does not show the full role names and it's not possible to tell one from another.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# From JIRA Administration -> System -> Project roles, create several roles with long names starting with the same prefix
# From Project settings -> Users and roles, click the Roles drop-down list

h3. Expected behavior
The list auto expands and shows the full names of the new roles

h3. Actual behavior
The list does not auto expand and only shows its default width, and it's not possible to tell the new roles from one another:
!role1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
h4. Workaround 1
# Select 1 of the long roles
# Click the Roles drop-down list again
# Now it shows the full names of the roles with similar name length:
!role2.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround 2
# Enter the following code into Announcement banner, which will set minimum dropdown element width to 500px (other value can be used):
{code}
<style type="text/css">
#select2-drop {
min-width: 500px;
}
</style>
{code}
# Now the element will get wider after opening:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Roles drop-down list does not auto expand to show long role names

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create a story of 3 points. Se the story points in the "Create Issue" screen
 # Create a sprint called Sprint 1.
 # Drag the story out of the backlog into Sprint 1 and start Sprint 1.
 # Create Sprint 2, but don't start it.
 # Complete Sprint 1. When Jira prompts you, move the incomplete story to Sprint 2.
 # View the Sprint Report for Sprint 1. You'll see the story you created is listed in the ISSUES NOT COMPLETED section with 3 story points. (Expected behaviour)
 # Back to Backlog view, select the story and change the number of points to 5.
 # Go back to the Sprint Report for Sprint 1.

*Observed behaviour:*
 Story now shows "-" points.

*Expected behaviour:*
 Story should display 3 points, since this is the number of points when the sprint was completed (from step 6)
fields.summary: Changing story points on an incomplete issue will remove the story points value on the Sprint Report

fields.description:
*Problem Experienced*

Jira ends up with an index that doesn't contain filters, making it impossible to use filters just by providing their name (filter's ID has to be used).

*Existing Behavior*

During reindex (both background and foreground), if an exception is thrown during indexing any issue, comment, change history or worklog, Jira will not attempt indexing filters.

*Expected Behavior*

If indexing some issue, comment, change history or worklog fails, Jira will still attempt to index filters. Jira might be able to finish indexing all filters correctly or fail indexing just a few of them.

*Notes*

This behavior is a result of first logging ("Reindex All FAILED. ..."), *and then rethrowing* an exception inside CompositeIndexLifecycleManager#reIndexAll method, making Jira exit a loop responsible for running different indexers.
fields.summary: Jira will not reindex filters if indexing anything else fails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

According to the documentation emails retrieved by the email handler are not deleted from the mailbox:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-945111600.html#Creatingissuesandcommentsfromemail-POPorIMAPemailmessages

{quote}
On an IMAP mail server processed messages are not deleted but marked as read.
{quote}

But when an email is handler is created using IMAP the emails are deleted.
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# setup a mail server connection with IMAP protocol
# create an email handler using this connection
# Send and email to the account.

h3. Expected Result:
Processed emails marked as read.

h3. Actual Result:
Processed email are deleted from inbox.

h3. Note on fix
The current ticket is not a bug, but more like a feature request for new functionality for IMAP handler.  In short, we are *introducing a new UI control "+mark as seen+" checkbox* for Mail handlers using IMAP. 
See JRASERVER-62660 for more details.
fields.summary: Email handler using IMAP deletes emails from inbox

fields.description:
*As a* Product Owner

*I want to* quickly rank stories in the Scrum Backlog when I rank their parent Epic

*So that* I can quickly tidy up a board that may have been shuffled by various people creating new stories against epics but not ranking them
----
Currently you can do 2 things in a Scrum board:
 * Rank stories against one another in the main part of the backlog
 * Rank epics against one another in the Epics side-bar

This is fine and I understand the value of keeping these rankings separate but most of the time what happens is as follows:
 # The PO creates an epic and ranks it against others
 # The Development team splits this epic in many child stories over time. When this happens for several epics, with epic-less defects created as well in the meantime, the all the stories for one epic are scattered in the board 
 # Regularly, prior to the PBR, the Product Owner wants to make sure the ranking of the stories represent the ranking of the epics.

----
I am sure there are various ways to implement this functionality but as a possible option, there could be a button/toggle in the Epics side-bar. When ticked, if an epic is ranked on top of another epic then it also ranks all the stories for the epic ahead of the highest ranked story on the other epic.

Another solution would be to add a new contextual menu against epics in the side-bar (with Edit Name, Mark as Done, etc...) called "Rank stories together", which would rank all stories on the epic after the highest ranked story in this epic. That would be enough to prevent the cumbersome selection and dragging of stories.
fields.summary: Ability to quickly rank stories in Scrum backlog based on rank of epics

Users can navigate to the Atlassian Marketplace within Jira and request add-ons to be installed. This will send all groups defined under the Jira Administrators global permission an email notification indicating a particular user has requested a particular add-on.

We have observed these notifications can be sent to inactive accounts.

h4. Steps to reproduce

* Create an account that is a member of the jira-administrators group
* Set the account as inactive ( may require an external directory )
* Request an add-on as another user

h4. Expected behavior

Jira does not send an email notification to the inactive account

h4. Actual behavior

Jira will generate a notification for the inactive account and attempt to deliver it

h4. Workaround

Remove inactive accounts from all groups defined under the Jira Administrators global permission

fields.description:
h3. Symptom 
The /status endpoint returns a 503 error instead of FIRST_RUN on initial install. This means that any load balancer which relies on /status to report will not see the node as running. In AWS Cloudformation, this means that any new stack on versions 7.6.6, 7.6.7, 7.10.x, 7.11.0, and 7.11.1 will not work - the nodes are up and running but they are never added into the load balancer pool.

h3. Workaround
# Access the node directly (in AWS you will need to add your IP to the security group on the port that Jira is running on)
# Run through the setup wizard
# Once setup is complete, the /status endpoint will return RUNNING and the nodes will be added to the load balancer
fields.summary: /status endpoint returns a 503 error instead of FIRST_RUN on initial install
Disable "create" button until the attachment is added/uploaded. otherwise the file is not attached

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, local changes need to be done to the {{bin/setenv.sh}}, exampl:
{noformat}
JIRA_HOME="/Users/ayakovlev/work/app/jira/application-data/jira_7.12/"

JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=" -XX:+PrintGCDateStamps -XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps -XX:+PrintGCDetails"
{noformat}
So for each upgrade, you need to merge the changes, which adds extra work.
A couple of extra problems:
* in case those changes are not merged, that may lead to configuration issues 
* in case new _setenv.sh_ file is overwritten with the old file, that may lead to configuration issues 

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a separate file for JVM arg to keep it between upgrades and later to be included in the main config. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Add the required changes manually
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator I want to have a separate file for JVM arg to keep it between upgrades

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Table {{columnlayoutitem}} is used for storing Fields schema configs and it doesn't have optimal index structure.
Snippet from the table:
{noformat}
select * from columnlayoutitem limit 3;
  id   | columnlayout | fieldidentifier | horizontalposition
-------+--------------+-----------------+--------------------
 10300 |        10000 | issuetype       |                  0
 10301 |        10000 | issuekey        |                  1
 10302 |        10000 | summary         |                  2
{noformat}

Indexes: 
{noformat}
\d columnlayoutitem
             Table "public.columnlayoutitem"
       Column       |          Type          | Modifiers
--------------------+------------------------+-----------
 id                 | numeric(18,0)          | not null
 columnlayout       | numeric(18,0)          |
 fieldidentifier    | character varying(255) |
 horizontalposition | numeric(18,0)          |
Indexes:
    "pk_columnlayoutitem" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "idx_cli_fieldidentifier" btree (fieldidentifier)
{noformat}

{{columnlayout}} is being used during data loading:
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.column.DefaultColumnLayoutManager#transformToColumnLayoutItems
...
 final List<GenericValue> columnLayoutItemGVs = ofBizDelegator.getRelated("ChildColumnLayoutItem", columnLayoutGV, ImmutableList.of("horizontalposition ASC"));
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add index for _columnlayout_ column 
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
CREATE INDEX [IX_columnlayoutitem_COLUMNLAYOUT] ON [jiraDB].[dbo].[columnlayoutitem] ([COLUMNLAYOUT])
{code}

h3. Workaround
Add index manually
fields.summary: Create index for columnlayoutitem table

fields.description:
h5. Problem
Data Center nodes can ask another node to provide a full index snapshot when:
 # A new node is started and has no index
 # Index replication has fallen sufficiently far behind
 # The copy request has been triggered manually

Currently, this can take upwards of an hour, making the node where the index is broken or missing unusable. The chief contributor to this is the time it takes to zip the index, and this can be shortened by using a faster compression algorithm as long as the I/O device used for shared storage is fast enough.

h5. Suggested fix
* The compression method used can be configured with the *jira.index.snapshot.copy.archiver* application property. 
* Format: jira.index.snapshot.copy.archiver=(snappy|zip|tar)
* setting the jira.index.snapshot.copy.archiver application property to _zip_ will revert to the old behavior.
fields.summary: Copying index snapshots between Data Center nodes should be faster

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the Rich Text Editor to nest a table within a cell of a parent table does not render properly within Visual mode.

h3. Environment
Occurs with both Jira 7.6 and Jira Service Desk 3.9.6 (GSAC)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/edit a comment within Visual mode tab. 
# Click on the table button within the editor formatting toolbar to insert a table into the comment field.
# Notice pre-entered text within table  for header rows and cells, for example, {{heading 1}} ,{{heading 2}},{{cell A1}},{{cell A2}},{{cell B1}},{{cell B2}}
# Click within the cell A2 (for example), and then, once again, click on the table button within the editor formatting toolbar to insert a second table nested into the cell.
# Click *Add* (or for JSD: *Share with Customer* or *Add to issue only*

h3. Expected Results
A table is created, with a second, nested table created within one of the cells, as displayed exactly within the Visual mode WYSIWYG render (see [Visual editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver076/visual-editing-945112349.html]).

h3. Actual Results
||Heading 1||Heading 2||
|Col A1|Col A2|
|Col B1|
||Heading 1||Heading 2||
|Col A1|Col A2|

Notice above, instead of a nested table, the content is rendered as a single table within two header rows and a "missing" cell.

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround
fields.summary: Nesting tables using Visual mode render improperly

fields.description:
*Problem Experienced*

During a project import, Jira treats non-mandatory users just like the mandatory ones and will fail if it's unable to create them.

*Existing Behavior:*

If Jira fails to create at least 10 non-mandatory users during a project import, the process stops with a failure.

*Expected Behavior*

Jira logs/informs the user via UI about problems with creating the non-mandatory users, but it continues the operation. It fails only when the users are mandatory to the process.

*Notes*
Inside _DefaultProjectImportManager#createMissingUsers_ Jira tries to create all of the missing users. It doesn't differentiate between mandatory and non-mandatory users.
It gets the users from _UserMapper#getUsersToAutoCreate_ that gets the mandatory and non-mandatory users separately.

The bug can be fixed by either:
- returning only the mandatory users from the _getUsersToAutoCreate_ method (or actually creating a new method with that behaviour since this method is used in a few more places), or
- indicating which users are mandatory and which are not and increasing the failure count only for the former.
fields.summary: Jira stops project import after failing to create a non-mandatory user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a customer has a large number of fields listed in the "View Field Configuration" page or "Default Field Configuration" page https://<sitename>/secure/admin/ViewIssueFields.jspa the page takes >60 seconds to load.

The *ViewIssueFields* page can take up of more than 20 MB in size for the user to download and load it.

h5. Notes
Large JIRA instance
* with many custom-fields (1000+)
* with many fieldlayouts items:
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
select count(1) from fieldlayout; 
273

select count(1) from fieldlayoutitem; 
281158

select count(1) from fieldlayoutscheme; 
211

select count(1) from fieldscreen;
2762

select count(1) from fieldscreentab;
3156
{code}

First load will take longer time due to retrieve data from database, see bug JRASERVER-61704 
While subsequent load although faster, still takes longer time due to the page size being large.

h3. Suggested Solution
If we could add pagination, we could limit the number of fields to be displayed so it wouldn't time out and load faster.

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Add pagination for "ViewIssueFields" Field Configuration page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[Documentation describes|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/displaying-content-in-a-dialog-in-jira/#step-6-creating-the-simplest-of-dialogs] a way how to open the contents of the target page in a dialog by adding css class to the link. Starting from Jira 7.10 view issue page got updated toolbar which uses [AUI dropdown2|https://docs.atlassian.com/aui/latest/docs/dropdown.html] for dropdown component. There was a change in HTML markup so that _aui-item-link_ element is used on top of _a_ element and this is the reason the feature has stopped working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a web-item with <styleClass>trigger-dialog</styleClass> which will be rendered as a dropdown item. [An example|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/trigger-dialog-method-of-showing-a-dialog-no-longer-works-in-jira-7-10-x/21901].
 # Click on the item.

h3. Expected Results

Dialog will be shown with the contents of the link URI.
h3. Actual Results

User-agent navigates to the link URI.
h3. Workarounds
 # It's possible to create specialised/custom version of a dialog providing custom trigger – [further step in the same documentation page|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/displaying-content-in-a-dialog-in-jira/#step-9-creating-a-standard-dialog]. 
 # Apply Progressive enhancement technique, i.e. support both use cases 1) separate page — e.g. users can open dropdown item in the new tab 2) dialog by using "inline" parameter on the back-end and attaching your JS logic in the front-end.

details:
 * create a unique linkId of <link> item or styleClass and use it to attach JS logic, e.g. add event listener on click event where it can fetch the URI (from href attribute) with the following params: {{decorator=dialog&inline=true}} – similar is happening with built-in `.trigger-dialog` feature – and then use that content for a dialog (e.g. [AUI Dialog2|https://docs.atlassian.com/aui/latest/docs/dialog2.html]) component.

 * make use of [JiraWebActionSupport#isInlineDialogMode|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.11.0/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.html#isInlineDialogMode--] method in order to support both use cases.
fields.summary: Adding .trigger-dialog class to dropdown item doesn't open a dialog

h3. Summary
By default, the *Header Text Color* in the *Look and Feel* section s set to white (#ffffff). However, if we change the *Header Background Color* to white as well (#ffffff), we can see that the text color is not really white, but a very light shade of blue. 

This only seems to be the case with the default setting. If you choose any different color in the *Header Text Color* settings an then rever this back to white, true white will be applied to the text in the header.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira 7.10.x+.
# Do not make any modifications to the *Header Text Color* in the *Look and feel* page.
# Set the *Header Background Color* to white (#ffffff).

h3. Expected Results
No information is visible as text and background are using the same color.

h3. Actual Results
You can still view text, showing that, even though white (#ffffff) was configured, it is not really white, but a light shade of blue.

h3.Workaround
Change *Header Text Color* to any other color and then revert this setting back to white.
fields.summary: Header Text Color default white is not really white

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Scenario
Considering you are going to add a second LDAP directory to your Jira instance, by creating or re-enabling it, and you have a user with same 'username' in both LDAPs. Once you create/enable and sync the second LDAP, you may notice users appearing twice in the in the user picklist when:
# Adding a user to a role
# Trying to add the user as a watcher, reporter, assignee, etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.6.4 or newer
# Create sample business project
# Connect to an external directory containing users
# Attempt to assign an issue to one of the users in the external directory
** Observe: Assignee search (picklist) works and shows the users
# Connect and sync the second external directory containing users with the same 'username'
# Attempt to assign an issue to one of the users with the same 'username' in both the external directory
** Observe: Assignee search (picklist) will show duplicate users. Other fields such as 'Watcher' and 'User Role'.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should only show only the user entry in the topmost directory.

h3. Actual Results

Users are duplicated in the cached and as a result, user appear duplicate in user picker after the directory is created/enabled

h3. Workaround

*Recommended workaround:*
* Restart JIRA with both external directories enabled

*Alternate workaround:*
* Create new user directory then delete that new directory. 
** The act of deleting a directory will cause related caches to be reset.
* The directory does not need to function. 
** Create a new directory, fill out required fields. Click "Save and Test" once to get a connection error, click again to save the config. 
** After that disable the new directory then delete it.
fields.summary: Duplicate user in the user picklist (Cache issue)

Currently, if user tried to copy and paste large number of HTML based characters (more than 20855 characters) in RTE enabled comment field, following error will be shown in comment box instead of JIRA rendering the pasted text in HTML format:

{code}
Request Error

The server encountered an error processing the request. Please see the service help page for constructing valid requests to the service. The exception message is 'An error occurred during the activation of a particular registration. See the inner exception for details. Registration: Activator = API (ReflectionActivator), Services = [Innovation.GamesAPI.GamingVendors.Evolution.API], Lifetime = Autofac.Core.Lifetime.CurrentScopeLifetime, Sharing = None, Ownership = OwnedByLifetimeScope ---> An error occurred during the activation of a particular registration. See the inner exception for details. Registration: Activator = AuthService (ReflectionActivator), Services = [Innovation.Core.Contracts.Authentication.Services.IAuthService], Lifetime = Autofac.Core.Lifetime.RootScopeLifetime, Sharing = Shared, Ownership = OwnedByLifetimeScope ---> An error occurred during the activation of a particular registration. See the inner exception for details. Registration: Activator = UserService (ReflectionActivator), Services = [Innovation.Core.Contracts.Users.Services.IUserService, Innovation.Core.Contracts.Users.Services.IUserPrincipalService, Innovation.Core.Contracts.Users.Services.IUserRoleService, Innovation.Core.Contracts.Users.Services.IUserPasswordService, Innovation.Core.Contracts.Users.Services.IUserLockoutService], Lifetime = Autofac.Core.Lifetime.RootScopeLifetime, Sharing = Shared, Ownership = OwnedByLifetimeScope ---> An error occurred during the activation of a particular registration. See the inner exception for details. Registration: Activator = BlockAdapter (ReflectionActivator), Services = [Innovation.Core.Contracts.Blocks.Services.IBlockService], Lifetime = Autofac.Core.Lifetime.RootScopeLifetime, Sharing = Shared, Ownership = OwnedByLifetimeScope ---> An exception was thrown while invoking the constructor 'Void .ctor()' on type 'BlockAdapter'. ---> The type initializer for 'Innovation.Data.UserBlock.Service.Factories.UserBlockFactory' threw an exception. (See inner exception for details.) (See inner exception for details.) (See inner exception for details.) (See inner exception for details.) (See inner exception for details.)'. See server logs for more details. The exception stack trace is:

at Autofac.Core.Resolving.InstanceLookup.Activate(IEnumerable`1 parameters) at Autofac.Core.Resolving.InstanceLookup.Execute() at Autofac.Core.Resolving.ResolveOperation.GetOrCreateInstance(ISharingLifetimeScope currentOperationScope, IComponentRegistration registration, IEnumerable`1 parameters) at Autofac.Core.Resolving.ResolveOperation.Execute(IComponentRegistration registration, IEnumerable`1 parameters) at Autofac.Integration.Wcf.AutofacInstanceProvider.GetInstance(InstanceContext instanceContext, Message message) at System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext.GetServiceInstance(Message message) at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.InstanceBehavior.EnsureServiceInstance(MessageRpc& rpc) at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ImmutableDispatchRuntime.ProcessMessage41(MessageRpc& rpc) at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ImmutableDispatchRuntime.ProcessMessage11(MessageRpc& rpc) at System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.MessageRpc.Process(Boolean isOperationContextSet)

PS: This happens with other sites which interpret html format. Eg: https://wordtohtml.net/

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA ships by default with Tomcat access logs enabled which also includes the time to commit request as part of the Access log Valve configuration "%D flag".
 This time takes into account the network time which is needed to finish committing the request.
 We need a way to tell if the customer network is quick or slow and to tell if the time JIRA spends to prepare the requests is the bigger component or if the network latency is the bigger component.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please add the new tomcat flag *"%F"* this is the time needed to prepare the request or simply time to put first byte from JIRA point of view on the network.
 This will help us troubleshoot more effectively and will save a customer a restart to add the %F to tomcat server.xml Access log Valve. 
 Please check this tomcat bug: [https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=55102]
h3. Workaround

Add the "%F" flag manually in the Access Log Valve in server.xml,  which require a JIRA restart.
{code:java}
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve" pattern="%a %{jira.request.id}r %{jira.request.username}r %t "%m %U%q %H" %s %b %D %F "%{Referer}i" "%{User-Agent}i" "%{jira.request.assession.id}r""/>
{code}
fields.summary: Add time to prepare request in JIRA Tomcat access logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Importing from Cloud to Server fails with mismatched datatype error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export data from a cloud instance
# Set up or access a test Server instance (7.6.7, 7.6.3, 7.10, 7.11 all reproduce the problem)
# Attempt to import the data

h3. Expected Results
The import works without problems

h3. Actual Results
The import stops at 90% and then fails producing an error. Tables appear to be partially generated during the process, so a new import requires deleting and recreating the application DB beforehand. 

The error below can be observed in both {{catalina.out}} and {{atlassian-jira.log}}

{noformat}
2018-08-03 12:54:25,073 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR admin 2848x568x1 yp50xh 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin>:Error executing update for SQL statement 'ALTER TABLE dbo.AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE ADD CONSTRAINT fk_ao_54307e_requesttype_to_issue_issue_id FOREIGN KEY (ISSUE_ID) REFERENCES dbo.JIRAISSUE(ID)'
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.create(ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ForeignKeyAroundImporter.after(ForeignKeyAroundImporter.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:584)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:758)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: Column 'dbo.JIRAISSUE.ID' is not the same data type as referencing column 'AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE.ISSUE_ID' in foreign key 'fk_ao_54307e_requesttype_to_issue_issue_id'.
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException.makeFromDatabaseError(SQLServerException.java:258)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.getNextResult(SQLServerStatement.java:1535)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.doExecuteStatement(SQLServerStatement.java:845)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement$StmtExecCmd.doExecute(SQLServerStatement.java:752)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.TDSCommand.execute(IOBuffer.java:7151)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.executeCommand(SQLServerStatement.java:219)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.executeStatement(SQLServerStatement.java:199)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.executeUpdate(SQLServerStatement.java:680)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:34)
	... 18 more
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
Remove the following line from {{activeobject.xml}} file:
{{<foreignKey fromTable="AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE" fromColumn="ISSUE_ID" toTable="JIRAISSUE" toColumn="ID"/>}}  

The following steps can be used to perform and validate this change:
- Unzip cloud backup
{code:java}
unzip cloudbackup.zip
Archive:  cloudbackup.zip
  inflating: entities.xml
  inflating: activeobjects.xml
{code}
 - Expand xml to multiple lines:
{code:java}
xmllint activeobjects.xml --format > activeobjects_fixed.xml
{code}
 - Remove the foreign key entry from activeobjects (note I did my testing on OSX so you may have to alter the sed command and remove the '' after -i for Linux):
{code:java}
sed -i '' '/foreignKey fromTable\=\"AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE/d' activeobjects_fixed.xml 
{code}
 - Let's check our work so far. To start we'll make another copy of activeobjects in the multiline format:
{code:java}
xmllint activeobjects.xml --format > testing.xml
{code}
 - Now we will Diff the fixed file to the original to ensure only 1 line was removed (output should look like below):
{code:java}
diff testing.xml activeobjects_fixed.xml
604d603
<     <foreignKey fromTable="AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE" fromColumn="ISSUE_ID" toTable="JIRAISSUE" toColumn="ID"/>
{code}
 - Delete old activeobjects file and rename the fixed one to {{activeobjects.xml}}
{code:java}
mv activeobjects_fixed.xml activeobjects.xml
{code}
 - Zip backup back together
{code:java}
zip -r fixed.zip activeobjects.xml entities.xml
{code}
 - Move the backup to the import directory on the destination instance and perform the import
fields.summary: Importing from Cloud to Server fails with mismatched datatype error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The issue navigator shows custom field value that is not valid for an issue type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two custom fields namely
#* Team - configure the context to be available to all issue types except Epic
#* Epic Group - configure the context to be only available to Epic
# Create an issue with a type Bug and fill up the Team custom field 
# Edit the issue type from Bug to Epic, leave the Team value and add a value to Epic Group custom field.
# Query the issue navigator via issue key and add the columns Team and Epic Groups on the list view. 
# The issue shows up with both values on the Team and Epic Group custom fields. 
# However, if you query the issue navigator (Advanced search) via issue key AND Team = 'xxx' it shows that no issues returned. 

h3. Expected Behavior
The issue navigator should not show the values for a custom field that is not valid for the current issue type. 

h3. Actual Behavior
The issue shows up with both values on the Team and Epic Group custom fields. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Issue Navigator should not show custom field/value that is not valid for an Issue Type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Data Center uses a caching library called [EHCache|http://ehcache.org/], and contains an in-memory cache of certain project, user and group data. On the very first node start (if no others are running) this cache is built from querying the database. When additional nodes are started, the cache is built from querying the existing nodes in-memory cache and propagating that data into the node that is starting up. Other caches are built only locally by filling the node's own copy of the cache directly from the database.

Additionally when JIRA Data Center restarts a node reindex thread runs which is designed to synchronise changes between the nodes - this can also contribute to the increase in network traffic.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Starting up a node should not affect other nodes performance


h3. Actual Behaviour
When adding node during busy hour  we can notice surge in network traffic below

  !image.png|thumbnail! 

Which result in increased of the overall response time of all other nodes in the cluster for 3 minutes. 
||node-1||node-2||node-3||
|​  !node2_slow.JPG|thumbnail! |  !node3_slow.JPG|thumbnail! ​|​  !node4_slow.JPG|thumbnail! |

h3. Note
There some improvements related to the cache replication during start-up:
* JRASERVER-63515
* JRASERVER-66392

Also in recent version 7.6.4 there is a fix JRASERVER-66839 which mostly contributing to this problem. 

h3. Workaround
Avoid adding/removing nodes during peak hour
fields.summary: JIRA Datacenter start generates large network traffic result in higher response time

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Issue view freezes

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create 2000 projects.
 # Create 1000 custom fields.
 # For each custom fields change the context from 'All projects' to explicit list of all projects (2000).
 # Enter view/create issue.

h3. Expected Results:
Page is working without any problem.

h3. Actual Results:
First page load is frozen for couple of minutes.

h3. Workaround (Jira < 8.0.0):
(!) Before executing this operation please [back up your system|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html]
* Create index on key (custom field) column in ConfigurationContext table.
fields.summary: Issue view/create page freeze

fields.description:
h4. Problem
When generating a Time Tracking Report in Jira with a large project, this Jira will consume a large amount of memory causing the system to go into Full GC loops, causing the system to become unresponsive.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an instance of Jira where a single project has a large amount of tickets
** In my testing I had created 300,000 issues with no versions defined.
# Navigate to the Project > Reports > Time Tracking Report
# For the options available, I left it as:
** No Fix Version - as my project has no versions
** Issues All
** 
# Click Next

h5. Expected Behaviour
Jira will generate the report

h5. Actual Behaviour
* Jira spins and the system becomes unresponsive.
* Checking GC logs we see full GC loops:
{code}
2018-08-01T20:31:43.180+0000: 648.744: [Full GC (Ergonomics)  2459749K->2369409K(3728384K), 5.4404543 secs]
2018-08-01T20:31:52.700+0000: 658.264: [Full GC (Ergonomics)  2835329K->2437673K(3728384K), 3.9910132 secs]
2018-08-01T20:32:04.515+0000: 670.079: [Full GC (Ergonomics)  2903593K->2441514K(3728384K), 3.7994684 secs]
2018-08-01T20:32:14.223+0000: 679.787: [Full GC (Ergonomics)  2907434K->2527066K(3728384K), 3.7724623 secs]
2018-08-01T20:32:30.006+0000: 695.570: [Full GC (Ergonomics)  2992986K->2531551K(3728384K), 3.8731525 secs]
2018-08-01T20:32:47.692+0000: 713.257: [Full GC (Ergonomics)  2983788K->2531133K(3728384K), 4.0234298 secs]
2018-08-01T20:32:55.271+0000: 720.835: [Full GC (Ergonomics)  2997053K->2702921K(3728384K), 4.1808309 secs]
{code}
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report with a Large Project can Cause High Memory Pressure
